author: Rophe

review: I really like this little guy. I've been using a Roku player and the only advantage it has over the Fire Stick is its native music/video player. I am using Plex on the Fire Stick to help with this. If a native player is ever added this product will be even better.Navigating the menus, settings, apps and options all are easy and quick. Setup was easy. The most difficult part was getting in into the HDMI port of my TV. That is only difficult due to me being in a wheelchair and my wife had to do it. I was up and configuring my WIFI and exploring new stuff in moments after that task was finished.

review: Amazon nearly hit a home run with the Fire Stick. I love that I can link it to my phone or tablet and have a full keyboard to input searches. I love that it has a remote, too. It's blends the ease of use of a Roku with the portability of a Chromecast. I think Amazon looked at the best features of the other streaming sticks, combined them, and threw in a few neat tricks of their own.My only complaint is that I wish I could browse and select Prime Music from the device, rather than having to add playlists from the PM page.Overall, it's definitely a winner, and I'm glad I bought two. One for home, and one for travel.
